meanings.definition: In a manner characteristic of or appropriate to a college or its students.
meanings.sent1: She spoke collegially to her classmates during the group project.
meanings.sent2: The students worked collegially on the research paper together.
meanings.sent3: The professor jokingly danced collegially around the lecture hall.
meanings.sent4: The campus atmosphere was filled with collegially buzzing energy.
meanings.sent5: The college event was organized collegially, creating a welcoming environment.

meanings.definition: In a manner characteristic of or appropriate to colleagues; in a cooperative or friendly manner.
meanings.sent1: The team members collaborated collegially on the project.
meanings.sent2: The colleagues communicated collegially to solve the issue.
meanings.sent3: The coworkers playfully competed collegially in the office game.
meanings.sent4: The group discussion flowed collegially, fostering a positive work environment.
meanings.sent5: The staff meeting was conducted collegially, encouraging open dialogue.
